snippet: If markets could talk, they’d be saying to Janet Yellen: “We don’t think you’ll raise interest rates as much as you say you will.”
abstract: News Analysis; Federal Reserve, having declined to raise rates in short term, faces challenge in deciding  how best to protect US economy in face of low inflation worldwide; Fed officials have signaled intention to raise rates this year, yet market indicators signal that investors do not believe change will be dramatic nor that it will come anytime soon; situation indicates how difficult it is for Fed to extricate itself from period of low rates.
lead_paragraph: If markets could talk, they’d be saying to Janet Yellen: “We don’t think you’ll raise interest rates as much as you say you will.”

headline.print_headline: The Fed Is Learning How Hard It Is to Exit Easy Money
headline.main: The Fed Is Learning Just How Hard the Exit From Easy Money Will Be
